author: Gus_263
title: The king mathias' latest version
review: This is the first review of the latest version of king mathias, before jayko becomes king. This was released when the knights received the sir title, and he continued being king. The colors are great, but the gold isn't too shiny. He don't have additions, like the version of king jayko or lord vladek in 2006, but still good, a lego and action figure. The body is only one piece because it have gear systems to make moves, if were separated, the costs were expensive. The crown is smaller than the knights' helmets. The sword is the same of the sir santis minifigure, have a detail that looks like with a paw of bear or lion, the symbols of santis and mathias, with details of heads of these animals in the armor on the body. Altough this is an action figure, is very useful to lego themes, like the arms and legs parts, compatibles with system, exo-force, and many themes, also technic. Another features are the cover, darker than the used on jayko. The blue color is included, makes a great scheme with gold, and is more included on this set than the king version of jayko.

author: Shadow_Crawler
title: Hail King!
review:
This set is very good, let's see:
Box/Fortress = 5/5
Nicely done, with fortress detail and nice picture.

Building = 4/5
Not challenging. Only, legs, hands + weapons, and huge torso.

Playability = 5/5
This is the set to buy if you are looking for playability. There are two gears on the back to rotate the shield & sword. The torso is cool-looking too.

Overall = 4/5
Pros:
No stickers
Nice sword & shield
Nice torso
Excellent crown

Cons:
I hate the 'robe'

author: AETerry
title: King Mathias Review
review: In retrospect, why I picked up these large action figure type sets, I don't know. In comparison to the first wave, the second version of these figures are far better. There's more of a modular snap together build then a Bionicle style build, which I myself prefer this modular to the Bionicle style if I'm going to put out money for these types of sets. The body and limbs look better and the shield is plastic, not card board.
